mhs.src.storage

Class GoogleCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • mhs.src.storage.GoogleCalendar

  • public class GoogleCalendar
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides services to connect with a user's Google Calendar Supported functionality: 1) Create event entry 2) Retrieve event entry(s) 3) Update event entry 4) delete event entry To use the above services: 1) retrieve access token with user's email and password 2) create an instance of this class with retrieved access token
    Author:
    John Wong

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GoogleCalendar(java.lang.String appName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String accessToken)
      Creates an instance of GoogleCalendar using the user's access token and email

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CalendarEventEntry createEvent(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String endTime)
      create an event in the current user's default Google Calendar time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM example: 29 October 2012 3pm +0800 GMT, "2012-10-29T15:00:00+08:00"

      create an event based on a Task object

                                                 java.lang.NullPointerException

        email - user's Google account email
        userPassword - user's Google account password

        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - invalid login parameters or Internet connection unavailable

      • createEvent

        public CalendarEventEntry createEvent(java.lang.String title,
                             java.lang.String startTime,
                             java.lang.String endTime)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      ServiceException,
                                      java.lang.NullPointerException
        create an event in the current user's default Google Calendar time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM example: 29 October 2012 3pm +0800 GMT, "2012-10-29T15:00:00+08:00"
        Parameters:
        title - name of event
        startTime - start date and time of event
        endTime - end date and time of event
        Returns:
        created event entry
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - unable to write to Google Calendar
        ServiceException - Internet connection unavailable
        java.lang.NullPointerException
